titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the John Bell Condliffe Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Aparna Mukherjee; machine-readable finding aid created by James Lake

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-05-23T15:37-0700

change.item: <date calendar="gregorian" normal="20120813" era="ce">August 13, 2012</date><item>Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Samira Bozorgi</item></change><change><date calendar="gregorian" normal="20040323" era="ce">March 23, 2004</date><item>PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::John Bell Condliffe papers)//EN" "reg_069.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).</item>

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, and printed matter, relating to various aspects of world economic conditions, especially international trade, the history of the development of world commerce, and the economic development of Australia, New Zealand and the entire Pacific basin region. Includes autobiographical writings.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John Bell Condliffe papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1990.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Melbourne, Australia
B.A., Canterbury College
M.A., University of Canterbury
Lecturer in Economics, University of Canterbury
Served in the First World War with the New Zealand Division
Married Olive Grace Mills
Gainville and Caius College, Cambridge
Professor of Economics, Canterbury College
Attended the first conference of the Institute of Pacific Relations at Honolulu
Research Secretary, Institute of Pacific Relations, Hawaii
Author, New Zealand in the Making
Visiting Professor of Economics, University of Michigan
Author, Problems of Food and Population in the Pacific Area, and The Pacific Area in International Relations
Member, Economic Intelligence Service, League of Nations
Author, China To-Day: Economic
Author, World Economic Survey
Author, A Short History of New Zealand, and War and Depression
Professor of Commerce, University of London
Author, Markets and the Problem of Peaceful Change, and A Survey of International Research in Europe

Recipient of Howland Memorial Prize, Yale University
Author, The Changing Structure of Economic Life
Professor of Economics, University of California, Berkeley
Author, The Reconstruction of World Trade
Author, Report Upon a Survey International House, University of California, Berkeley

Received Honorary degree of LL.D., Occidental College
Author, Agenda For a Postwar World
Author, The Economic Pattern of World Population
Research Associate, Institute of International Studies, Yale University
Associate Director, Division of Economics and History, Carnegie Endowment for International Peace
Author, The Foreign Economic Policy of the United States, and The Common Interest in International Economic Organisation

Naturalized citizen of the United States
Author, How Much Tariff Protection for Farm Products?, La Politica Economic Exterior De Estados Unidos, Exchange Stabilization, and World Economic Survey
Author, Proposals For Consideration by an International Conference on Trade and Development
Author, Obstacles to Multilateral Trading and The Foreign Loan Policy of the United States

Recipient of Wendell Wilkie Prize
Author, The Commerce of Nations, The Economic Consequences of Scientific Research, and Point Four and the World Economy
Author, Technological Progress and Economic Development and International Trade and Economic Nationalism
Fellow, American Association for the Advancement of Science
Received Honorary Litt.D. degree, University of New Zealand
Adviser, Indian National Council of Applied Economic Research, New Delhi
Author, The Welfare State in New Zealand
Senior Economist, Stanford Research Institute
Author, The Development of Australia
Author, Foresight and Enterprise and From Adam Smith to Keynes -and After
Author, The Balancing of International Payment: Money and Goods
Author, The University and Technology
Author, The Economic Outlook for New Zealand
Author, Te Rangi Hiroa
Erskine Fellow, University of Canterbury
Author, Defunct Economists
Gold Cross, Royal Order of Phoenix (Greece)
Author, Reminiscences of the Institute of Pacific Relations
Died, Walnut Creek, California

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Speeches and writings, correspondence, and printed matter, relating to various aspects of world economic conditions, especially international trade, the history of the development of world commerce, and the economic development of Australia, New Zealand and the entire Pacific basin region. Includes autobiographical writings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographical sketches, clippings, conference agenda, interview, leaflets, notes, telegram relating to the life of John Bell Condliffe, arranged alphabetically by form.

did.unittitle: Interview (Summary of interview of John Condliffe by others)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Significant correspondence of John Condliffe, arranged alphabetically by correspondent. Includes a few letters neither from nor to John Condliffe, arranged alphabetically by Condliffe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Less significant correspondence of John Condliffe, arranged chronologically by year. Includes a few letters neither from nor to John Condliffe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts, notes, printed copies, abstracts of speeches and writings by John Condliffe, reviews of his books, arranged chronologically. Also includes significant correspondence of John Condliffe relating to the writing and publication of his biography of Sir Peter Buck, along with a letter and an autobiographical chapter by Sir Peter Buck.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts of undated, and mainly unpublished writings by John Condliffe, arranged numerically by chapters. Also includes some handwritten notes, typescript versions of papers, speech and report and a few printed copies of articles whose publication dates cannot be ascertained

did.unittitle: "The Application of Research To Economic Policies In Developing Societies," both holograph and typescript versions
The Economic Aspects of Soviet-American Relations, printed copy
The New Order In China, printed copy
"The Teacher and his Influence," Liberty And Learning, printed copy
World Trade and Employment, printed copy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts, published articles, conference papers, leaflets, SRI bulletins, sketch, memorandum are arranged chronologically. In some cases includes speeches and articles written by others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lectures, clippings, travel accounts, reports, speeches, seminars, papers arranged alphabetically by subject

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Annual reports, booklets, bulletins, clipping, conference program, speech by the President of the United States, printed articles, stickers, arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This addition to the collection has not yet been described. Please let the Hoover Institution Archives know if you would like to see this material described.
